para_P.title: Is another presidential debate on the horizon?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among prospective presidential candidates (from any political party) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a greater domestic box office debut than the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office debut for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as listed on Boxofficemojo at the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office figures for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 plus $53,113,752.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool"?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $132,434,639 which is the box opening for **Deadpool** (2016).

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass those of "Deadpool"?
para_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $132,434,639, which is the box office opening for **Deadpool** (2016).

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will a minimum of 5 nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 3 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 3 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will there be a minimum of 3 nations securing their first gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if 3 or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, as determined by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they claim suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still very concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures combined would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend revenue in the United States for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed $132,434,639?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) surpass $132,434,639, which is the opening total for **Deadpool** (2016).

question.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before September?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to September?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office through death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not applicable. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.title: Are Russian athletes going to be excluded from participating in the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Russian athletes are excluded from participation in the 2024 Olympics under any of the following: (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. The resolution will be based on the official roster of countries and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or from trustworthy media sources that indicate the 2024 Olympics are either in progress or have finished without Russian involvement. For a **Yes** resolution, there must be no more than 34 Russian athletes competing in the 2024 Olympics. The figure of 34 was selected as 10% of the [Russian athletes who took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to accommodate a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

Should more than 34 Russian athletes compete in the 2024 Olympics, this query will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are either cancelled or delayed until 2025 or later, this question will be deemed ambiguous.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative number signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

"House of the Dragon" S2E8 (title TBA) IMDB link

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **No** if teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in these eight team sports during the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- soccer 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these competitions for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

The question can be settled as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for instance, if neither team competing in the final of the last event has won any of the other competitions).

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the men's pole vault Olympic record will be surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, during the 2024 Paris Olympics, any male pole vaulter successfully clears a height of 6.04m or more, based on results provided by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be matched or broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 5.92m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the men's pole vault Olympic record to be equaled or surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if any male pole vaulter at the 2024 Paris Olympics successfully clears a height of 5.92 meters or more, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If no athlete achieves this height, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

para_P.title: Will the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 individuals in the United States be recorded within four weeks following the peak of COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) from the date when the combined peak for all three is reached, as reported by the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week timeframe will be determined based on the end dates of the weeks. The CDC utilizes "epidemiological weeks" that start on Sunday and conclude on Saturday. The rate considered will encompass all ages, races, and genders. Please refer to the fine print for the appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season will be defined as commencing with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending on June 1, 2024.

To accommodate potential data updates and reporting delays, the resolution of the question will rely on data available after the reporting delay period, specifically when the relevant statistics for the current season are not represented as a dashed line, which typically occurs four weeks following the week's end date.

question.title: Will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' includes the following:

-A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
-Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

Videos posted on his social media which were filmed outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

para_P.title: Will JD Vance utter the word "Couch" prior to August?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if J.D. Vance makes a public reference to the term "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If he does not mention it, the market will resolve to "No."

Variations of the word will be considered for the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' encompasses the following:

- A spoken instance of the term "Couch".
- Any written reference to the term "Couch" distributed through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication methods, regardless of capitalization (@JDVance counts, but @SenVancePress does not).

Videos shared on his social media that were recorded outside of this market's specified time frame will not contribute to a "Yes" resolution.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview recorded on camera lasting over 45 minutes before July 2024 concludes?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's guest appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another such face-to-face interview for no less than 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market does not encompass press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest spots on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only include 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the presidential race and step down from his position before July concludes?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Joe Biden makes a declaration that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will resign from his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his office by that date. A statement of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If he does not make these announcements, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

If no such announcement is made, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will there be any break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.

“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 40”

“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 40”

Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

This will be finalized upon official release, but will be concluded earlier if reliable sources leak any information regarding a hiatus in advance. I do not participate in voting on my own inquiries.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident happening in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
The outcome will be Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, other than the assailant(s), between, and including, the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The outcome will be No if the aforementioned does not occur.

An occurrence will be deemed a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

para_P.title: Are Russian competitors going to be excluded from the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Russian competitors are excluded from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under any of the following: (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. The resolution will be based on the official roster of nations and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports that confirm the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have taken place without the involvement of Russian athletes. For the resolution to be **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians may be competing in the 2024 Olympics. The number 34 was selected as it represents 10% of [Russian athletes who took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics), allowing for a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

Should more than 34 Russian athletes take part in the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will be considered ambiguous.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete under the Russian flag at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls involving the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before June 1, 2024, any of the following four occurrences take place, based on official announcements or [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines removes at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC removes at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. 

If none of these events are reported before that date, then this will resolve as **No**.

question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2025, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions):

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats who is stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

If none of these reports arise before that date, then this will resolve as **No**.
